content.description: Angled chimney with decent face holds. Awkward and dirty, but fun.
content.protection: Small compact pads at the bottom, and maybe a helmet
content.location: See beta photo.  After crossing the bridge, head north along the river, going up a short trail and back down the other side.

content.description:
Named after the big slithery local napping at the base when we arrived.

Many variations. Friction with the occasional solid edge.
content.protection: Plenty of pads and spotters. Bad fall potential at the top.
content.location: First slab after you cross the bridge.

content.description: Obvious low-angle off-width/chimney. Pretty unaesthetic in my opinion.
content.protection:
Bad landing, a little bit PG-13.

Pretty easy to throw a knee bar throughout the whole thing if need be.
content.location: Behind the Rattlesnake Slab. See beta photo

content.description: Slabby finger crack to undercling to thin frictiony top out.  Fun highball
content.protection: Highball slab. It's possible to veer left and climb through the bushes to avoid the top out.
content.location: After crossing the bridge, pass the first few slabs and walk another 20-30 feet north. See beta photo.

content.description: Sit start and climb the short face while slapping up the arete with your left hand.
content.protection: 2-3 pads and some spotters.  Bad landing without foam.
content.location: On the opposite side of the Rattlesnake Slab, the short gently overhanging face.

content.description: Two mantles back to back on slippery polished rock. Second mantle is the crux. Top out is mossy and committing.
content.protection: River below you with a swift current, where a failure would undoubtedly be epic.
content.location: Pass the initial boulders from the bridge, go up the trail to the left of the finger crack slab, and head all the way around to the start.  The mantle moves are big and obvious. See beta photo.

content.description:
A quality boulder program, for Southern Sequoia. On the obvious overhanging boulder across the bridge and upstream from the other problems mentioned here. SC is spray painted on the boulder.

Start low and left with a left hand on a small peanut bulge on the lip and the right on the obvious rail. Ride the lip to the obvious jug and throw for the top.

No idea about the grade...
content.protection: Pads, possibly a spotter. Watch for poison ivy at the base.
